DOC.brief_summary: This randomize double-blinded study examine effect topical Acetyl Hexapeptide-8 AH8 ) improve cosmetic appearance experience oily skin .
DOC.brief_title: Topical Acetyl Hexapeptide-8 Cosmetic Appearance Oily Skin
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose randomized double-blinded study investigate whether topical Acetyl Hexapeptide-8 improve oily skin . Up 15 adult subject recruit . Each half face randomize receive either topical treatment AH8 10 % Lotion formulate Cetaphil® Moisturizing Facial Lotion placebo vehicle treatment consist Cetaphil® Moisturizing Facial Lotion , twice daily application 4 week . The study consist total 3 session : baseline visit , 2 week 4 week follow assessment . Subjects also ask complete Oily Skin Self-Assessment Scale ( OSSAS ) Oily Skin Impact Scale ( OSIS ) survey first session . They fill two OSSAS survey ( one side face ) second third session . The OSSAS survey include subjective assessment four component oily skin : visual , blotting , tactile , sensation . At visit , cosmetic appearance facial skin score clinically dermatologist use validated 3-point scale shine ( 1 = high , 2 , moderate 3 = low ) , oiliness ( 1 = normal , 2 = easily visible 3 = extensive ) 16 . High-resolution digital photograph facial skin use photography facial analysis instrumentation take baseline visit document facial appearance image analysis shine level . Sebum leave right cheek measure sebumeter correlate oily appearance note high resolution facial photograph .
DOC.criteria: Subjects age 18 Recent intradermal botulinum neurotoxin injection within last 6 month . Known hypersensitivity AH8 Ablative resurfacing procedure face within 6 month study initiation Report pregnancy breastfeed Use immunosuppressive drug
